name: Neujahrstag
description: New Year’s Day; the first day of the year.

name: Berchtoldstag
description: Swiss holiday observed the day after New Year’s Day, associated with traditional Berchtold’s Day customs.

name: Tag vor Karfreitag
description: The day before Good Friday; typically an early closing / reduced working time.

name: Karfreitag
description: Good Friday; Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus.

name: Ostermontag
description: Easter Monday; Christian holiday on the day after Easter Sunday.

name: Sechseläuten
description: Zürich’s spring festival; afternoon off is traditionally granted for the parade and the burning of the “Böögg”.

name: Tag der Arbeit
description: Labour Day (May Day), celebrating workers’ rights and the labour movement.

name: Tag vor Auffahrt
description: The day before Ascension Day; typically an early closing / reduced working time.

name: Auffahrtstag
description: Ascension Day; Christian holiday marking the Ascension of Jesus, 40 days after Easter.

name: Pfingstmontag
description: Pentecost Monday (Whit Monday); Christian holiday the day after Pentecost.

name: Knabenschiessen
description: Traditional Zürich festival (youth shooting competition); afternoon off is commonly granted in the city/canton.

name: Heiligabend
description: Christmas Eve; typically observed as an afternoon holiday with reduced working time.

name: Weihnachtstag
description: Christmas Day; Christian holiday celebrating the birth of Jesus.

name: Silvester
description: New Year’s Eve; typically an early closing / reduced working time.
